channel.title: Linux Journal
channel.description: Linux Journal focuses specifically on Linux and other open-source OSes, allowing the content to be a highly specialized source of information for open-source enthusiasts.

image.title: Linux Journal
image.description: News for the web from Linux Journal

item.title: Tinyminds.org for Everyone
item.description: A new web site for all levels of the Linux community offers cheat sheets, HOWTOs, reviews and more.

item.title: Usenix Tutorials Answer Deep Questions
item.description: What can an old-school UNIX organization teach you about new Linux stuff anyway?

item.title: Use Binary-Only Kernel Modules, Hate Life
item.description: Last week's Usenix Technical Conference brought together academics, high-end information technology professionals and old-school UNIX gurus. And Linus Torvalds.

item.title: VPN Implementation in Cluster Computing
item.description: Negotiating security and scalability issues with clusters by setting up a virtual private network.

item.title: Linux and Scooby-Doo
item.description: One more on the ever-growing list of animated films using Linux opened this past weekend.

item.title: A Successful Linux/Open-Source Business Model
item.description: Tom discusses how to use the Public Domain and community open-source projects to subvert media conglomerates.

item.title: Building an Inexpensive, Powerful Parallel Machine and Using It for Numerical Simulations
item.description: Faced with a limited budget, Roman researched and built his own parallel system for multiprocessor simulations.

item.title: Is Beauty Only Pixel Deep?, Part 2
DSI: A New Architecture for Secure Carrier-Class Linux Clusters
item.description: An approach for distributed security architecture that supports advanced security mechanisms for current and future security needs, targeted at telecom applications running on carrier-class Linux clusters.

item.title: Celebrating the 20th Anniversary of the Swiss Open Systems Group
item.description: maddog travels to Zurich in a bid to make up for lost time.
